modules.description: This module manages ARP cache operations and network interactions for IPv4 and Ethernet addresses. It supports creating and modifying static and dynamic ARP entries, handling incoming ARP packets, generating replies, and sending gratuitous ARP frames. Concrete use cases include resolving IPv4 addresses to MAC addresses for network communication, managing ARP cache timeouts and retries, and handling ARP queries with customizable merge logic.

This module handles ARP frame decoding and encoding for Ethernet and IPv4, providing operations to convert between byte buffers and a structured representation. It supports parsing raw data into typed ARP packets, including error handling for malformed input, and serializing packets into network-ready bytes. Use cases include network stack implementations and packet analysis tools where ARP messages must be constructed or inspected.

This module implements an ARP layer that manages IP-to-MAC address resolution over Ethernet. It allows binding and unbinding IPv4 addresses, sending and responding to ARP requests, and querying resolved MAC addresses while handling GARP packets on IP changes. Use cases include configuring virtual interfaces with multiple IPs, resolving MAC addresses for network communication, and managing ARP responses in a network stack.

This module implements an ARP layer for managing IP-to-MAC address resolution over Ethernet. It supports binding and unbinding IPv4 addresses, sending and responding to ARP requests, and handling GARP packets on IP changes. It works with Ethernet frames and IPv4 addresses, providing concrete operations for network configuration tasks such as setting up virtual interfaces and resolving MAC addresses for communication.
